meanings.definition: To cause to hold or exhibit a bias different from the truth or what is reasonable.
meanings.sent1: Her strong emotions misbias her judgment in important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The news article misbias the readers with its one-sided view.
meanings.sent3: Don't let your favorite color misbias your choice in the art competition.
meanings.sent4: The fog of anger can misbias our perception of reality.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks misbias the audience's understanding of what is possible.

meanings.definition: To give a bias to; prejudice.
meanings.sent1: The loud music misbias his opinion on the party's success.
meanings.sent2: The media misbias the public against the new policy.
meanings.sent3: His lucky socks misbias his belief in superstitions.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds misbias the mood of the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise misbias the student's perception of their abilities.
